title: Why is it called 'Python'?
content: While many people assume the name Python Programming comes from something related to the Python snake,it actually comes from the TV comedy series 'Monty Python's Flying Circus.'
author: jultol

title: Python has overtaken French in primary schools
content: Believe it or not, Python surpassed French as the most popular primary school language in 2015. 60% parents would prefer their children to learn Python than French.
author: dylber

title: Python does not require a compiler
content: Python is a high-level, interpreted language that does not require a compiler. Python code is stored in a .pyc file, which serves as the Python engine and eliminates the need for a compiler.
author: seamcl

title: C Language was not called C at the beginning.
content: It has been named as C after passing many stages of evolution.
author: faimar

title: Why it is named as C?
content: There is no such logic behind the naming of C Language. It was developed to cover all the inabilities of B language (simplified version of BCPL). So, it was just named C as it is next to B in the English alphabets.
author: jonor

title: C was considered as the high level language
content: But today many programmers consider it as a low level language as it supports only scalar operations.
author: jultol

title: C++ introduces Object-Oriented Programming
content: C++ supports the four primary features of OOP: encapsulation, polymorphism, abstraction, and inheritance.
author: dylber

title: C++ is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language.
content: It supports generic programming and low-level memory manipulation.
author: seamcl

title: C++ not purely object-oriented
content: We can write C++ code without using classes and it will compile without showing any error message.
author: faimar

title: Java was called Oak at the beginning
content: It was eventually changed to Java by Sun's marketing department when Sun lawyers found that there was already a computer company registered as Oak.
author: johnor

title: Java was just an accident!
content: Gosling and his team was building a set-top box and started by 'cleaning up' C++ and wound up with a new language and runtime.
author: jultol

title: Most popular user interface
content: Currently, about 3 billion mobile phones are working in Java, as well as 125 million TV sets and each Blu-Ray player.
author: dylber

title: C Sharp name is stimulated by the musical notation.
content: Here sharp, represent the written note which should be made a semitone higher in pitch.
author: seamcl

title: C# language is good for developing games.
content: It is also used by Unity(the majority leader in commercial game engines) to develop games.
author: faimar

title: C# is an oop language that is based on C++ and Java.
content: It combines the power and flexibility of C++ with the simplicity and ease of use of Java.
author: johnor

title: JavaScript is single threaded.
content: Lots of people who use multi-threaded programming thinks its working is slow as it would not be able to make use of all the cores of the CPU properly.
author: jultol

title: JavaScript supports regular expressions
content: A concise and powerful syntax for text manipulation that is more sophisticated than the built-in string functions.
author: dylber

title: 'JavaScript hijacking'
content: A known attack in which a tag on an attacker’s site damages a page on the victim’s site that returns private information such as JavaScript or JSON
author: seamcl
